agency_desc: Provides community health services throughout Indiana.
site_name: INDIANA HEALTH CENTER - JACKSON COUNTY ANNEX
service_description: Offers behavioral and primary health care, including general, gynecological, and school/sports/employment exams, disease management, laboratory testing, and immunizations to patients of all ages.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for services or financial needs assessment (if applicable).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial network of Methadone, Suboxone, Buprenorphine, and Vivitrol clinics providing medication assisted therapy and counseling services for patients recovering from addiction.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioid drugs (including opium, morphine, codeine products, heroin, oxycodone, and hydrocodone). Services include medication, counseling, education, and referrals to other agencies as needed.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule intake assessment.

site_schedule.name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders

site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- In state of withdrawal at intake (not used opiates in the last 24-48 hours) - Note: This does NOT apply to pregnant women. -- Addicted to or dependent on opiates for a minimum of one year -- Without an active prescription for opiate medications -- Willing to submit to physical exam, drug testing, and urine specimen collection

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry and gas vouchers.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and a clothing pantry to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Jackson County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that operates a limited-admission shelter and promotes responsible pet ownership through adoption and outreach programs.
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals in Jackson County and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services and accepts surrendered animals from the public on an as space is available basis.
site_details: Call for more information.  -- Call immediately to notify the Humane Society if pet is missing. -- Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: To Surrender: Living in Jackson County -- All Other Services: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) or Evergreen Card -- For a resident library card: Living in Crothersville in Jackson County
Persons who are home-bound

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) or Evergreen Card -- For a resident library card: Living in Crothersville in Jackson County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) or Evergreen Card -- For a resident library card: Living in Seymour in Jackson County

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open, limit one visit per month -- Must meet income guidelines

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Provides a food pantry with perishable and nonperishable food items and hygiene products. Please enter through the main office doors.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Families of students attending a school in the Brownstown Central Community School Corporation

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry.
service_description: Offers financial assistance with electric, gas, water, and heating fuel. Funding is limited, up to $100, and not always available.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment, leave a voicemail for a return call.
site_eligibility: Limit of assistance once per 12 months

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry.
site_name: FIRST BAPTIST CHURCH OF CROTHERSVILLE - CLOTHES COTTAGE AND FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, hygiene supplies, and diapers to people in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Vernon Township
Open; offered when clothing cannot be found at Clothes Cottage
Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Seymour in Jackson County.
service_description: Provides water and sanitary sewer utility services for the city of Seymour in Jackson County. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_schedule.name: Local Bus Services
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7am-4:30pm -- Bus Hours: Mon-Thurs 6am-6pm; Fri 6am-5pm

site_schedule.name: General Paratransit/Community Ride Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7am-4:30pm -- Bus Hours: Mon-Thurs 6am-6pm; Fri 6am-5pm

site_eligibility: Open
Varies by service; Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Seymour in Jackson County.
service_description: Provides daily curbside recycling for residents of the city of Seymour. Accepts plastic and glass bottles, aluminum and steel cans, cardboard, and paper. Hazardous material may be dropped off at the facility.
site_eligibility: Curbside Recycling: Living within Seymour city limits -- Hazardous Materials: Jackson County
Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. Leave name and phone number for return phone call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Jackson County

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF JACKSON COUNTY
agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF JACKSON COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for income-eligible persons in Jackson County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor "sweat equity" toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail to request an application. -- Visit the website to download an application.
site_eligibility: Household income falls between minimum and maximum established income guidelines by HUD (guidelines vary by household size; call for information) -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides electric service to customers.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in specific areas.
site_details: Walk in or call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, by phone, or by automatic withdrawal from bank account; a drop box is available at this location.

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Providers
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Bartholomew, Brown, Clark, Jackson, Jefferson, Jennings, Lawrence, Monroe, Scott, and Washington County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Solicits individual and corporate donations to fund and support partner agencies and programs that address human service needs in Jackson County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURT - JACKSON COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials in Jackson County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURT - JACKSON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT 1
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Jackson County, Superior Court l handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Jackson County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Jackson County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURT - JACKSON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT 2
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Jackson County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
Jackson County juveniles age 17 and under
Offenders assigned to probation by the Jackson County Courts

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Jackson County.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to Jackson County persons in need, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability or to make a request.
site_eligibility: Residents of Jackson County -- Senior citizens -- Mobile home occupants -- Persons with low income
Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry, hot meal, and host a local support group.
service_description: Offers a free hot meal to all in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open
Persons seeking support and their family/loved ones

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides families and individuals the skills necessary to become self sufficient through intervention and education.
service_description: Provides a weekend supply of food to Jackson County youth in need.
site_details: Visit the website to download and print program application/release form. -- Walk in during distribution hours to return completed form and receive food.
site_eligibility: Living in Jackson County -- Youth ages 2-18 (youth age 18 must still be enrolled in school) -- With household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level
When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.
Living in Jackson County (excluding Crothersville) -- Limited to assistance one time per 12 months

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to older adults and those with disabilities in Bartholomew, Brown, Decatur, Jackson, and Jennings Counties. Serves as Indiana's Area 11 Agency on Aging for south central Indiana.
service_description: Provides a hot nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for older adults age 60 or older. Reservations at least 24 hours prior are appreciated but not required.
site_details: Call 24 hours in advance to reserve a meal.

site_schedule.name: Congregate Meals/Nutrition Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Reservations: Mon-Fri 9am-1pm -- Meal Times: Vary by location

site_eligibility: Living in Bartholomew, Brown, Decatur, Jackson, or Jennings County -- Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a food pantry, clothing vouchers, and a homeless shelter to Jackson County residents.
service_description: Provides clothing vouchers to local Jackson County Goodwill store. Limited service area. Limited number of vouchers available.
site_details: Walk in or call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Jackson County -- Have not received vouchers in the past six months
Living in Jackson County -- Limit two visits every month -- Volunteers must pass a background check

Living in Jackson County -- Families with legal custody of children 18 years of age or younger -- Pregnant women/couples -- Limited criminal history; no violent felonies or sex offenses -- All adults must be able to work 35+ hours/week; unless receiving Social Security

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Jackson County.
service_description: Maintains the Jackson County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.

site_schedule.name: Correctional Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Jail Phone: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older -OR- accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)
Open; serves Jackson County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open
Births/deaths occurring in Jackson County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Living in Jackson County -- Age 19 or older
Living in Jackson County
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

Living in Jackson County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for Jackson county is currently closed. -- No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, call for income guidelines. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Jackson County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Jackson County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Jackson County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
site_name: JACKSON COUNTY - CLERK'S OFFICE AND ELECTION BOARD
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Jackson County
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Receives payment of property taxes.
service_description: Collects taxes and in the case of delinquent taxes may order the sell of real property to pay delinquent taxes. Receives distributions of local income and other taxes that are collected by the state such as real estate tax, personal property tax, mobile home tax, state assessed tax, and the following miscellaneous taxes: auto excise tax, inheritance tax, and innkeeper's tax.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to properties in Jackson County)

agency_desc: Serves as a membership organization that promotes business and economic development.
service_description: Serves as a membership organization that promotes business and economic development in the greater Seymour area.
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Membership required; call for details

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from Schneck Medical Center. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the Patient Financial Services office to request a Financial Assistance Application.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Schneck Medical Center (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (Those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for free care.)

Living in Jackson, Jennings, Scott, or Washington County -- Must be 40 years of age or older -- Clients must have no insurance -- Income must be at or below 100% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Must have a physician in which the results can be sent
Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides walk-in medical care for minor injuries, illnesses, health conditions, and health screenings. Also provides sports, school, and employment physicals.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides intentional, research based programming for girls; program is designed to build girls’ capacity to become adults who are responsible, confident, economically independent and personally fulfilled. We also provide 5 prevention programs throughout Jackson County Schools to both boys and girls.
service_description: We provide intentional, research based programming during the critical afterschool hours and during summer camp for girls. Our program is designed to build girls’ capacity to become adults who are responsible, confident, economically independent and personally fulfilled.  Our teen volunteers are mentors teaching them invaluable leadership skills. We also provide 5 prevention programs throughout Jackson County Schools to both boys and girls.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit the website for program and activity information.
site_eligibility: Girls, grades K-12
Age 18 or older

agency_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF SEYMOUR
agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF SEYMOUR
service_description: Provides a positive, supervised environment for young people after school and over the summer. Programs emphasize character and leadership, education and career development, the arts, life skills, health and fitness, sports, and recreation.

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF JACKSON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that increases the understanding and to assist those with a mental illness.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF JACKSON COUNTY
service_description: Offers mental health information, referrals, and educational resources. Advocates on behalf of adults and children with mental and emotional disorders and their families. Promotes increased public awareness on mental health issues and lobbies for public and private policies that protect the rights and well-being of persons with mental illness.

service_description: Offers free tutoring services and a variety of other services including ESL (English as a Second Language) classes; classes on basic literacy, workplace literacy, and family literacy; Rosetta Stone; computer classes; language translation; and public access to the Internet.

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, anger management, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Jackson County. agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a free hot and cold meal to anyone in need in Jackson County.
service_description: Provides a free hot meal to those in need. First-come first-served while supplies last.

agency_desc: The Jackson County Surveyor's Office maintains land mapping and boundaries congruent with the best interests of the county and its citizens through section cornerstones, maintaining the county regulated drain system, and field surveying as necessary.
service_description: Provides the following county services: maintains section corners; files legal surveys; maintains voter precinct maps, annexation, and de-annexation; investigates drainage obstructions; and researches and documents all cemeteries in Jackson County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Limited to properties in Jackson County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including financial assistance.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Jackson County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Jackson County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
